episodes.title: Psychology of the Dark Triad Personality Type: Emphasis on Machiavellianism #darktriad #psychology
episodes.description:
Hard to believe I have yet to make a video on the Dark Triad personality type but today I'm sharing the psychology behind machiavellianistic, narcissistic, and psychopathic traits that go into the Dark Triad. From ways to recognize the dark triad traits, to a few tips for healing, this video heavily emphasizes machiavellinism but also touches briefly on psychopathy and narcissism. A long windy video to help break down the complex [dark triad] personality type and how each leg of the triad ultimately supports the other "leg" of the triad. Thank you for watching and I'm happy to be back! Hope you have been well, staying safe and healthy, and I look forward to making more videos on dark psychology in the near future.

CHAPTERS:

10:31 Pay attention to this (safeguard)
11:51 Reign of Terror with High Control Cultic Leaders

19:41 No one asks to be a victim: Exploiting the emotional vulnerabilities and the aftereffects for survivors

27:43 Strategic Interactions in Machiavellianism
29:12 Similiarities between Narcissim and Machiavellianism: Information is power
31:08 The overlapping dynamic in the Dark Triad and a random example of how the dark triad personality type can fly under the radar for years at a time
37:09 Us versus them effect: Don't ask questions and what happens when you do
40:47 Video on Narcissim and Psychopathy and empathy deficit
42:22 CHILDREN of parents with the DARK TRIAD traits
44:16 The confusing nature of being in a relationship or dynamic with someone who had Dark Triad traits: trauma responses that can ensue

episodes.title: Mental health therapy after leaving a cult or abusive relationship?WHAT TO LOOK FOR in a #THERAPIST
episodes.description:
Deciding to reach out for mental health therapy after leaving a high control cult, and or abusive/domestic violence relationship can feel overwhelming and daunting. What should you look for in a trauma informed mental health provider? What are traits of therapeutic practice that can be very helpful to keep in mind post cult and or post abusive relationship therapy? Today I’m breaking down a few of the tenets of trauma informed therapy, working with a mental health provider, and what you can start doing now if you don’t yet feel ready to reach out for mental health therapy and counseling. Resources for both self education and educational /informative websites and resources for finding a therapist are linked in the video and down below.

episodes.title: Fran & Aubree's Stories: Surviving & Exposing The Truth of The Farm [MENTAL HEALTH/RELIGIOUS CULT]
episodes.description:
What happens when you seek out treatment for mental health concerns, or are looking for an environment to heal from past trauma--yet the place you attend ends up having manipulative and controlling practices that fit (Steven Hassan's) BITE Model of Authoritarian Control to a T? Today, I am sharing with you the brave stories of Fran and Aubree of the The Farm Project MO who are here to illuminate the cultic and high control practices of a group called Harvest Home Our Father's Farm. We are speaking candidly about Fran and Aubree's experiences with this center and the practices that are being implemented: the manipulation, indoctrination practices, spiritual/religious abuse used to control behaviors, and capitalizing on a person's time of need (and search for mental health support). Big thanks to Aubree and Fran for coming forward to share about their amazing organization and experiences with this group.

To connect with Fran, Aubree, and learn more about their advocacy work:

episodes.title: The Exploitation of Cognitive Biases in Cults & {Unhealthy} Relationships #cults #mlm #fakegurus
episodes.description:
What happens when we hold onto a relationship or set of rigid teachings in a controlling, cultic group for longer than is good for us? What happens when a person may present one way, but function very abusively behind closed doors and why can it be hard to accept this (in some cases)? Today I'm sharing some common cognitive biases that affect all of us from time to time. No one is immune to cognitive bias(es), but what happens when unhealthy and narcissistic cult leaders capitalize on this? I'm sharing cognitive biases to be aware of and ones specifically that come into play in high control, authoritarian cultic environments, but also cognitive biases that can keep us involved in unhealthy relationships and investments for longer than we may want to be. The list of cognitive biases is VERY long--and today is a small sampling of common biases that can present time to time.

episodes.description:
(CHAPTERS BELOW!) Today, I'm interviewing Timothy who is sharing his own personal journey with the Institute in Basic Life Principles (IBLP), Advanced Training Institute (ATI), and the ALERT Academy. The intent of this video is to share how Tim was able to engage in his own deconstruction process, learn more about himself, listen to the internal questioning (cognitive dissonance) he experienced while in IBLP & ALERT, and start to recognize the facade of high control groups.  

This video is NOT meant to demonize all religious and or spiritual beliefs as research continually shows that having faith, or believing in a Higher Power can be a big source of comfort. Religious groups become problematic, as Tim and I will discuss, when scripture is twisted, rigid rules are enacted, and individuals are discouraged from having their own thoughts and or opinions.

episodes.title: The Toxic and Manipulative World of MLM Practices Explained #psychoanalysis #antimlm #scams
episodes.description:
Today I'm taking a look at The Toxic and Manipulative World of MLM Practices. I was motivated to make this video because as a therapist, I cannot stand seeing people taken advantage of. There is a whole psychology behind how multilevel marketing companies (MLM's) Manipulate you into joining and then staying far longer in their companies then you may want to.I'm outlining several of the toxic and manipulative practices that are used by multilevel marketing companies, also sometimes referred to as direct sales companies, or even pyramid schemes. Multi level marketing companies, otherwise known as MLM's, use many different tactics to draw in members. MLM's, also sometimes known as direct sales, or pyramid schemes even, often target people in an effort to increase their (the companies') own financial gain. The psychology of MLM's is complex. Modern, everyday cults can look a lot differently than what we saw with Jonestown or the Manson Family. But the truth is, many of the similar practices prevail: indoctrination of rules within the members, behavioral change, use of shame, and manipulation.

This is a video I might get some pushback on, but is one I've been wanting to make for a long time. We are currently in the age of life coaching exploding onto the scene in our culture. From understanding the problematic nature of the Rachel Hollis hustle culture toxic positivity to shaming language used by motivational speakers like Tony Robbins and other coaches, my goal with this video is not to demonize the self-help field but instead point out areas to be aware of in your quest for self improvement.

episodes.title: Elizabeth Holmes Takes the Stand in Surprising Turn of Events! #theranos #elizabethholmes
episodes.description:
In a surprise turn of events, Elizabeth Holmes, former owner of now defunct biotech company, Theranos, took the stand and began her testimony this past Friday. In this video today, I'm breaking down what exactly she shared, what was asked of her by defense attorney, Kevin Downey, and some of my own speculation on Theranos and the Elizabeth Holmes case. 

Day 2 and 3 of Elizabeth HolmesTestimony here: Elizabeth Holmes BIG Admission Day 2 and 3 Trial Update #theranos #fraud #commentary https://youtu.be/M9u9CMaiTaI

A little backstory (please see link https://youtu.be/zb5gS38nBeE to watch previous video which details this information) If you're here, you most likely know the highlights from the Elizabeth Holmes and Theranos story. As a very quick recap, Elizabeth Holmes was the founder and former chief executive officer of Theranos which was largely touted to be the next major biotech company. She started the company at the age of 19 after rather famously at this point dropping out of Stanford university. Her overall mission in creating Theranos was to start a company that offered a more cost-effective efficient alternative to a traditional blood test. Elizabeth Holmes created Theranos which alleged that they had the capability to test patients for essentially hundreds of diseases and monitor bodily functioning with only a few drops of blood versus the standard regular blood draws.

In 2015 and 2016, Elizabeth Holmes company Theranos began to fall apart. There was a Wall Street Journal investigation done John carreyou who reported that the Theranos claim to fame technology where only a few drops of blood taken by a finger prick-were not testing accurately or successfully. In addition to this there were several patients who came forward who had grossly in accurate test results and readings. 

By 2018,this reporter John Carreyrou who first put the story out there for the Wall Street Journal ended up publishing Bad Blood and in June 2018 Elizabeth Holmes and her ex romantic and business partner, Sunny Bhawani were indicted on federal wire fraud charges where it was alleged that they were engaged in a multi million dollar scheme in order to defraud investors as well as a scheme to mislead and defraud doctors and patients. As of present, they both face up to 20 years in prison.

Back to this video: In addition to breaking down Elizabeth Holmes taking the stand, I'm also breaking down and sharing a very memorable witness that shared his testimony in the past week and what made his testimony so different from others.

This is a fascinating case of EXTREME and unethical "fake it till you make it", fraudulent behavior, and individuals not necessarily being who they said that they were. When I found out Elizabeth Holmes took the stand, it spurred me on to begin covering her trial more so in full. She is supposed to be going back on the stand Monday and Tuesday of this next week, November 22 and 23rd so I will be keeping tabs on what happens. 

Have you been following the case of Elizabeth Holmes and Theranos? What are your thoughts on her going ahead and going on the stand in her own trial?
